subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: Articles on Frank's Box
author: Misty Dawn
full_text:
--0-971817623-1181964809=:99980
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=iso-8859-1
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 8bit

LOL yeah that one took a moment to notice I tried making the word article complete I thought oh its missing the "e" that didnt work LOL so then i went back and noticed the period on the end. 
   
  Great work though I didn't get a chance to make a long post on that as I was late for work. You do very nice work. It was very detailed.  It is nice that finally some people look at it from Franks perspective, many have experienced his work but few get to know the man befind the the scenes or see the unbelievable lengths he goes to to work on these and ask nothing in return. 
   
  I personally want to say I have known Frank privately for years now and I dont know anyone more dedicated...yeah a few of us come close but most do not have constant scrutiny, attacks from all sides, and words put into thier mouth. 
   
  He is a tough guy, and I owe ya a personal thank you again Sumption. Not for any boxes you made or for any of the great ideas you gave and not for answering about a jillion technical 'evp word' questions that I couldnt understand. Just for being a friend. You are a great friend Frank! 
   
  Misty
   
  rosemary_guiley <reguiley@...> wrote:
          Thanks for the feedback everyone! I'll be interested to see what 
rolls in through the TAPS magazine. The issue will be featured next 
weekend at the next Ghost Hunters haunted event, at Eastern State 
Penitentiary in Philly. People will be getting it, and it's sure to 
generate some converation. (Bill, Randy & I will be there). BTW, 
Randy alerted me that the hot link for the pdf includes a period 
which makes it not work, and I don't know how to edit the original 
post, so I would suggest highlighting & cutting the period out. My 
apologies. I fixed it on itcbridge.com under Forum/EVP/Ghost Box.

--Rosemary

-- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, "phaser_2000" <phaser2000@...> wrote:
>
> Rosemary,
> 
> I ditto what Frank says here! It's a great article! Thanks again 
for
> doing it.
> 
> -Randy
> 
> --- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, "Frank Sumption" <franks-boxes@> 
wrote:
> >
> > Thanks Rosemary!
> > 
> > Frank
> > 
> > 
> > >From: "rosemary_guiley" <reguiley@>
> > >Reply-To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
> > >To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
> > >Subject: [EVP-ITC] Articles on Frank's Box
> > >Date: Fri, 15 Jun 2007 14:09:23 -0000
> > >
> > >(Cross posted on itcbridge.com forum)
> > >
> > >Mark Macy has posted two articles I wrote about Frank's Box,
> > >concerning the controversy the box has caused in the paranormal
> > >investigation community. The articles are published this month 
in
> > >TAPS Paramagazine. The pdf can be viewed at
> > >http://spiritfaces.com/x200706ParamagArticl.pdf. For those not 
in
> > >ghost work, TAPS is The Paranormal Atlantic Society, members of 
whom
> > >star in The SciFiChannel's popular Ghost Hunters reality show.
> > >
> > >Briefly, at a Ghost Hunters haunted week at The Stanley Hotel in
> > >Colorado in March, the 200+ attendees were given demonstrations 
of
> > >the box by Chris Moon. There were two open mike nights in which 
lots
> > >were drawn for people to come up and ask questions via the box.
> > >Chris interpreted answers, and was assisted by medium Chip 
Coffey.
> > >Many of the attendees had never heard of the box, and most of 
them
> > >had never seen it in operation, and it caused quite a stir. 
Chris
> > >also took the box into one of the hotel's more active haunted 
rooms,
> > >as part of the featured ghost investigations.
> > >
> > >There were two other boxes present on site for part of the time,
> > >owned by Randy Schneider and Bill Murphy. Fortunately, these 
boxes
> > >were not pressed into service for paranormal tap dancing. I was
> > >especially happy to be able to participate in small group private
> > >sessions with both Randy and Bill (and one of which included 
Mark),
> > >which I found far more illuminating.
> > >
> > >One article concerns the controversy over the box (for example,
> > >should it be used in haunted places to provoke ghosts; can it 
dial up
> > >the dead on demand), and the other is a Q&A interview I did with
> > >Frank.
> > >
> > >Personally, I agree with Frank's vision for the box as an ITC 
tool.
> > >
> > >Rosemary Ellen Guiley
> > >
> > >
> >

> > http://mobile.msn.com
> >
